news.title: Retail sales increased 0.2% in February, though spending up less than expected
news.summary: Retail sales were expected to show a 0.6% increase in February, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate. Retail sales are expected to be up 0.5% in February.

news.title: Klarna, nearing IPO, plucks lucrative Walmart fintech partnership from rival Affirm
news.summary: Affirm and Klarna are two of the world's biggest BNPL players. Klarna is set to go public just as Affirm are set to do the same.

news.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says White House is heading off a 'guaranteed' financial crisis
news.summary: Bessent believes market pullbacks are benign. Trump's pro-business policies will boost the economy in the long run, he says.

news.title: 'See you in four years': Canada flexes economic muscle as tariff negotiations continue
news.summary: Trump's plans for tariffs and comments about Canada becoming a state has enraged the country's consumers and politicians. Trump's plan for tariffs has enraged consumers, politicians and businesses.

news.title: PepsiCo buys prebiotic soda brand Poppi for nearly $2 billion
news.summary: Allison and Stephen Ellsworth launched the brand back in 2018. Poppi's founders are based in New York City and Los Angeles.

news.title: Intel’s new CEO is putting his money where his mouth is
news.summary: Lip-Bu Tan will purchase about $25 million in stock shortly after taking over as CEO. The move will give him immediate financial alignment with the moves he makes at Intel.

news.title: Why cruise stocks are a buy now, according to this analyst
news.summary: Cruise stocks have been falling, but J.P. Morgan says buy because there have been no signs of reduced demand despite all the macro noise.

news.title: Women’s March Madness teams are being paid for the first time — but they’re splitting $200 million less than the men
news.summary: Players won’t receive any of the prize money themselves, but their schools’ basketball programs and athletic departments reap the rewards. The winner will be announced at a later date.

news.title: Retail sales in the U.S. barely rise. Is the economy slowing?
news.summary: Retail sales barely rose in February in another sign the economy might be weakening. Businesses and consumers digest rapid-fire changes in Washington by the Trump White House.

news.title: This sector may be the ‘accidental beneficiary’ of a U.S. growth scare, says JPMorgan
news.summary: Emerging markets may be helped by a weaker dollar and lower U.S. interest rates, analysts say. They say the dollar is expected to continue to weaken against the euro and yen.
